## Classes

### <a name="profile_ondemand"></a>`profile_ondemand`

Main class for profile_ondemand

#### Examples

##### 

```puppet
include profile_ondemand
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `profile_ondemand` class:

* [`nodejs_version`](#-profile_ondemand--nodejs_version)
* [`ruby_version`](#-profile_ondemand--ruby_version)
* [`crons`](#-profile_ondemand--crons)
* [`enable_xdmod_export`](#-profile_ondemand--enable_xdmod_export)

##### <a name="-profile_ondemand--nodejs_version"></a>`nodejs_version`

Data type: `String`

The Node.js version to use for dependency

##### <a name="-profile_ondemand--ruby_version"></a>`ruby_version`

Data type: `String`

The Ruby version to use for dependency

##### <a name="-profile_ondemand--crons"></a>`crons`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash of cron jobs to set up

##### <a name="-profile_ondemand--enable_xdmod_export"></a>`enable_xdmod_export`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether to set up xdmod_export for ACCESS metrics

Default value: `false`

### <a name="profile_ondemand--navbar"></a>`profile_ondemand::navbar`

Configure the navigation bar for OOD

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `profile_ondemand::navbar` class:

* [`include_default`](#-profile_ondemand--navbar--include_default)
* [`navbar_items`](#-profile_ondemand--navbar--navbar_items)
* [`helpbar_items`](#-profile_ondemand--navbar--helpbar_items)

##### <a name="-profile_ondemand--navbar--include_default"></a>`include_default`

Data type: `Boolean`

Whether to include the default navbar items. Defaults to true

Default value: `true`

##### <a name="-profile_ondemand--navbar--navbar_items"></a>`navbar_items`

Data type: `Optional[Array[Hash]]`

Array of items to put in the navbar (left side)

Default value: `undef`

##### <a name="-profile_ondemand--navbar--helpbar_items"></a>`helpbar_items`

Data type: `Optional[Array[Hash]]`

Array of items to put in the helpbar (right side)

Default value: `undef`

### <a name="profile_ondemand--xdmod_export"></a>`profile_ondemand::xdmod_export`

Configure the xdmod export script

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `profile_ondemand::xdmod_export` class:

* [`token`](#-profile_ondemand--xdmod_export--token)

##### <a name="-profile_ondemand--xdmod_export--token"></a>`token`

Data type: `String`

Token used to authenticate with the log server
